body:
You can reproduce it on the Roq blog dir
start dev, edit the web-bundler js
and then open the index again

It's the problem connected to `io.quarkus.qute.runtime.devmode.QuteSetup`. In order to support [`quarkus.qute.dev-mode.no-restart-templates`](https://quarkus.io/guides/qute-reference#quarkus-qute_quarkus-qute-dev-mode-no-restart-templates) we attempt to reload all templates when a no-restart change is detected. However, message bundles are not reflected in this logic.

I don't think we could reliably identify the set of templates that need to bo reloaded (because of `{#include}` etc.).

The correct solution is probably to introduce a dedicated `TemplateLocator` for message bundles... so that the messages can be reloaded automatically.

issue.title: Qute message bundles: change the way message templates are loaded
issue.body:
- introduce a dedicated TemplateLocator so that the message templates can be reloaded automatically when a no-restart change occurs during the dev mode
- fixes #43944

issue.title: Qute NPE on hot-reload when updating web-bundler scripts

repository.name: quarkus-roq
repository.description: The Roq Static Site Generator allows to easily create a static website or blog using Quarkus super-powers.

issue.body:
`java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "io.quarkus.qute.Template.instance()" because the return value of "io.quarkus.qute.i18n.MessageBundles.getTemplate(String)" is null
  `

Until this is released: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/43944

issue.title: Bundling when application starts causes NPE

repository.name: quarkus-web-bundler
repository.description: Create full-stack web apps quickly and easily with this Quarkus extension. It offers zero-configuration bundling for your web app scripts (JS, JSX, TS, TSX), dependencies (jQuery, React, htmx, etc.), and styles (CSS, SCSS, SASS).

issue.body:
When I start my application with `mvn quarkus:dev` I get the following error (the application starts and works). If I press `s` for reload (or in general a hot reload) the error does not occur again.

I use Quarkus version `3.19.0`. I tried till `3.18.1` and that error occurs there too. (Maybe other versions before that too)

Maybe related: 

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/45670 

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/43944

My guess is that Arc is not available and Qute or Web Bundler tries to bundle when Arc is not available.

If I remove the web-bundler from the dependencies the error does not occur.


```java
2025-02-25 07:50:00,228 INFO  [io.qua.web.bun.dep.BundlingProcessor] (build-32) Bundle#mapping:
  main.js => /static/bundle/main.js
  main.js.map => /static/bundle/main.js.map

Exception in thread "Build Listeners" java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "io.quarkus.arc.ArcContainer.instance(java.lang.Class, java.lang.annotation.Annotation[])" because the return value of "io.quarkus.arc.Arc.container()" is null
	at io.quarkus.qute.runtime.devmode.QuteSetup$1.accept(QuteSetup.java:21)
	at io.quarkus.qute.runtime.devmode.QuteSetup$1.accept(QuteSetup.java:16)
	at io.quarkus.deployment.dev.RuntimeUpdatesProcessor.notifyExtensions(RuntimeUpdatesProcessor.java:613)
	at io.quarkiverse.web.bundler.deployment.DevModeBundlingProcessor.callNoRestartChangesConsumers(DevModeBundlingProcessor.java:146)
	at io.quarkiverse.web.bundler.deployment.DevModeBundlingProcessor.lambda$watch$1(DevModeBundlingProcessor.java:117)
	at io.mvnpm.esbuild.Execute.lambda$watch$2(Execute.java:84)
	at io.mvnpm.esbuild.Execute$Streamer.lambda$run$0(Execute.java:148)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1144)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:642)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583)
```
